description:
A little pricey but extremely convenient and it's open every day until quite late. You can find almost anything (even SFPD who you'll find pigging away - pardon the pun!) here and the deli counter is very good.
Jen, who I believe is one of the managers, is magic and always has time for a chinwag with us and some banter with the kids!
author: Foofa B.

description:
First time in to this little gem this last Sunday at Pawtrero's Dog Day Afternoon. Jennifer is amazing, food was great, and they are dog friendly!! 
We will be back!
author: K M.

description:
Alright, I've gotta update my review and give credit where credit's due.  Their salad bar is AWESOME.  

Based upon my negative experiences with their deli, I figured I'd try the salad bar instead.  No complaints there.  

+ Lots of variety -- veggies, cheeses, croutons, raisins, dressings, everything
+ Some bread (usually a roll or mini baguette) is available as well.

Just grab yourself a container and fill it up as you wish.  You're charged based upon weight.  Utensils and napkins are available as you exit.  Plus, the cashiers have been a bit friendlier than the deli workers, so that's pretty cool.

If it's a nice day outside, it's definitely good to come by and eat outside with the bay nearby as well.  

4 stars
author: Michael F.

description: They are so personable and really cater to the locals that live near here.  The customer service is top notch and you feel so much love walking into this store.   No, just kidding.  Think of your Quickie Mart with a better selection and much worse pricing.  I buy expensive everything here and this last time I showed up at 9:01 and got yelled at for trying to open the door.  The fresh food is decent but you really have to select wisely.  I am going to make an effort to just go to Safeway.  Same type of service but with much better pricing.  Honestly I didn't want to write this because I don't like writing anything perceived as negative, but I was motivated after I got yelled at, I think by the manager.  Oh well....
author: Sean D.

description:
Bayside Market is a convenient little grocery store and deli located right by the bay.

I've always walked passed this market thinking that it was just a small little shop for snacks, drinks, and a bit of produce. After coming here with my coworkers for lunch, I was surprised to find it to be quite large with a full salad bar and deli. There were lots of people here during the lunch hour so the lines did take a bit to go through, especially with the deli which requires one line for ordering followed by a separate line for paying. They have a sandwich special of the week that goes for ~$5.50 which is quite a deal while other sandwiches go for ~$7. The sandwiches aren't all that bad, but really not great as well, feeling rather bland and plain after eating the first half. The dutch crunch bread lacked the crunchiness I would expect from it. Overall, I found Bayside Market to be a convenient place to drop by to pick up a simple sandwich or salad for a good price in the area.
author: Joshua M.

description:
Large tasty sandwiches at a reasonable price. They don't hold back on the portions so you won't be hungry afterwards. Chips and beverages are fairly priced. Big salad bar too.

The only seating is a few tables outside, so don't plan on eating here if it's cold or wet.
author: Tony E.

description:
"Meh. I've experienced better" says it all.

Bayside really capitalizes on their location (right under a large apartment complex & a few blocks from two other ones); expect to pay 1.5x on almost all items, so I generally buy the one item I forgot from the store, etc. 

I've had their fresh food a few times - it's pretty average, maybe a notch below depending on what you get / when you get it. 

It's a hit or miss when it comes to the workers; I've had pretty pleasant ones who helped me locate specific items, but others who appeared somewhat rude.
author: Sam C.

description: Friendly staff but lacking in gluten free and allergen friendly variety. Deli items are often dry and taste stale and like they have either no seasoning or have been in the case for a couple of days. Overall, a lot of room for improvement...
author: Rachel M.

description:
I'm definetely like it! I live pretty nearby and it is convenient for me when I want to grab some quick bite for dinner. Their hot deli are pretty good and salad is fresh.
Some snacks and grocery goods are more pricy than other chain stores. So I don't do regular grocery shopping there, but just buy a little bit when I really need it and don't want to drive a long way.
author: Li D.

description: Small but convenient, with good selections. Slightly expensive so I don't really go that often. Very friendly staff.
author: S S.

description:
A helpful jewel in the otherwise unadorned lunchtime crown of boring Brannan. I like the mix of fresh items (walk-around salad bar, pre-made sushi, live deli) and packaged items (drinks, crackers, basic-drugstore-level and coop-market-level snacks). There's a lot of refrigerated items, like whole pickles, pre-prepared deli sandwiches, yogurt, and these are great for grab-and-go noshing. The deli has a variety of sandwiches available on breads, rolls, and wraps, plus an impressive complement of cold salads and other deli staples. 

I ordered a turkey sandwich, and was pleased to discover that there were at least three styles of turkey from which to choose (smoked, deli-style, and something else). I ordered my sandwich on a sourdough roll, but I wish I'd known it was a Boudin-style crunchy sourdough chewtoy, rather than a softer variety. Then again, given Bayside Market's proximity to Bakery Boudin, I could have anticipated. 

There's a nice little cache of black wrought-iron tables and chairs right outside, which makes this a great eating spot, as well. It's a little windy, so anchor down those napkins!
author: Austin J. A.

description:
I live SUPER close to this market so i usually end up doing some grocery shopping here. Keep in mind, it is extremely over priced but the location is unbeatable (for me) so i usually buy the necessities here when i'm too lazy to walk to safeway, which is a lot of the time. 

The staff is super friendly and helpful. The salad bar ROCKS and the sandwiches are great too (dutch crunch galore!)
author: Ilana B.

description: Everything here comes with a premium. And although I really like some of the folks here, some of the staff is incredibly rude. Not a good idea to treat your frequent neighborhood shoppers like crap in the era of Amazon Fresh, Google express and etc.
author: Yigit B.

description:
This place has everything you need...for about $2 more than you would normally pay for it.   It's the only place in the immediate 'hood, so take it or leave it.

That said, there is all the healthy and not so healthy stuff you need here, both for lunch or cooking dinner.   There are still weekly  sandwich specials that are $5.50-$5.99 each.  I haven't tried them, but my coworkers state that they are good.

The salad bar is $7.99/lb and I see it being maintained and cleaned throughout the day.

There are a few tables outside with a Bay view.
author: Ellie Y.

description:
Customer service ranges from employees ignoring you to being flat out rude. Leaves much to be desired.

Prices are a little high, but I don't mind because of its convenient location.
author: Rahel W.

description:
Bayside market is one of those places that charges you 1$ or 2$ more for convenience and it really is because there are no other stores within several blocks radius. 

The nearest pharmacy is Walgreens or Safeway supermarket which is over on 4th street near att park along the embarcadero and if you go the opposite  way along the embarcadero you can go to the ferry building where you can get fresh breads, fruits, meats, & cheeses also theres the farmers market on the weekends but buying groceries at the ferry building might be a bit pricey. 

Back to bayside market well there you can get almost anything conveniently, your frozen foods, beverages, dairy, deli meats, toiletries, beer, liquors, cigarettes, daily paper, lotto etc.  

What I like is that if I need something right away I can go in and get what I need but of course I'm paying for convenience lol. I also like the deli section they would have a small sign that has the sandwich of day that they make and everyday is different, one day they can do turkey the next day can be peppered salami sandwiches. Sandwiches are pretty good from there deli, they also have fresh pasta salads, and hot food.

Bayside market is a nice and clean market, some workers there friendly and some can seem rude. But shop at your own convenience.
author: Edwin R.

description: My only complaint about Bayside Market is that they should have the store ready before opening like all food and breakfast items so people dont have to wait 20 minutes just to have one breakfast sandwich prepared. It would be much easier if everything was ready, prepared and orginazed in the mornings. The owner or manager should have their employees come in at least 1 or 2 hours before opening. Other then that the store and emplyees are great
author: Trisha D.

description: Lived in the neighborhood for years and this is my go to local store. A little pricey but worth it for convenience when I don't have time to go to Trader Joe's costco etc.. just a lil sad the don't make soup there anymore
author: John V.

description: Overpriced but convenient.  No frills products, including hot deli, cold deli, liquors and beers, along with general convenience and hygiene items.  Think along the lines of Whole Foods prices with slightly lower quality.  Great if you're constrained by time and need to get something quick in SOMA.
author: David C.

description:
9/29/15-went in for something small and the girl working behind the counter asked me "Would you like anything else?" I replied, "No thank you that's all." She then said, "Are you sure? There's nothing in your pockets?" 

I was accused of stealing from this place in which I was a paying customer. This place is way overpriced, unfortunate that those living in this area don't have a ton of choices. I recommend going elsewhere to spend your money.
author: Brian A.

description:
Popped in here to grab a sandwich on my way to a Giants game. There was one person ordering when I arrived at the deli, and the woman working behind the counter was working at a snails pace. She was oblivious to the fact that there was at least 4 other people waiting. Finally, another girl (who looked like she was either having a really bad day, or she legitimately hated life) showed up and started taking orders and she was just as slow as the other woman. When it's my turn to order the woman starts taking my order and then she just walks away and helps someone else. What the hell, I couldn't believe it! After that she just ignored me until the other girl came over. I got my sandwich and panini and left annoyed. 

I opened my sandwich at the game and there was brown wilted lettuce and almost no mayo on it. The panini was mediocre at best. I do not recommend this place if you're looking for a quick bite to eat. There are waaaay better places down by the park. Hell, even Safeway's deli makes better sandwiches than this place AND you'll get better service.
author: Emily C.

description: My neighborhood everything store. Hard to complain about bayside. Even though it's a little on the pricey side it's worth it for the convenience, selection, and staff.
author: Vishrudh S.

description: Stopped by to get a Sami before going to the ballpark. Big Mistake!!! We stood at the deli counter for a good 5 mins (w no one in line) while two employees basically ignored us. I asked politely if they were still open and the guy muttered yeah and proceeded to carry on and ignore us. A "just a minute" or anything to that effect would have been better. Never going back here if I can avoid it. Refuse to support a small business w such awful customer service. So rude and unfortunate for them.
author: Marcia M.

description:
For a corner store/neighborhood market, this IS as good as it gets! I wish I had caved in earlier because this has become my go-to market. Living a block away, I always thought Safeway and Trader Joe's were my only options. I didn't realize this gem was actually worthy of the walk. I think it was the bad first impression I got a couple months back when I ordered a salami sandwich at the deli and got a turkey sammie. 

Because of that, I stuck with my Safeway/Trader Joe's. I would always dread hopping in my car to go to Safeway to stock up on a week's worth of goodies. I even went through a lazy Postmates phase. Finally, I have learned my lesson and I pop in here 2-3x/wk to pick up food to cover me for the next 2-3 days. They actually have a really decent stock of grocery items and not too shabby of a wine selection. It really is like a mini-size grocery store and it has all I need to keep my fridge and pantry full.

The people here are also super friendly - that is, if they don't work behind the deli. Everyone on the floor or those working the register are always really nice. The deli folks aren't too thrilled to be there half the time. One in particular rolls her eyes and looks utterly miserable every time I order from her, but whatever. #notmyproblem
author: Jaime L.

description: Had the displeasure of interacting with a seemingly miserable woman working at the deli. Every time I made a request, she made it seem as if I had just ruined her day. She would roll her eyes so far back into her head that I'm surprised they didn't pop out and start rolling down the street. Someone should really let her know that she wouldn't melt if she greeted customers with a smile every once in a while. Probably won't be going back if I can help it.
author: Gerald B.

description: This place is the worst store I've ever been to. Selection is awful. Every package size is too big or too small. The food is terrible here. Salad bar looks unsanitary. I wish they had healthier options. The line always takes forever and they only ever have one cash register open. They have too many frozen vegetarian options and not enough good frozen meals. How about chicken pot pie. Or bagel bites with pepperoni. Whyy. Their cold burrito and sandwich display is also unappetizing. I despise myself every time I come here.
author: Holly M.

description:
I thought it was going to be one of those teeny convenience shops but contrary to what it looks like, it's actually quite a spacious cave of food. There's a deli and pretty much everything else you'd expect from a convenience store.

Perfect for grabbing some quick grub in the area.
author: Loli L.

description: great little corner store in the neighborhood.. actually one of the only ones.  It's part of small local chain. Sure, it's a littler pricier but for more convenient (to neighborhood peeps) and decent fresh quality stuff it's good. The peeps who work there are nice, too
author: John V.

description:
This place employs at least one thief.    

My card started having fraudulent charges after I came here to purchase groceries last night.  $400 worth of ghetto clothes purchased in San Bruno and San Jose.  Easy to spot who ripped off my card when I hadn't used my card in over a week and had been at work during the purchases today.

So not only is this place where food goes to die, they steal from people they should be protecting.  I cannot wait until I get even Steven.  Similar to their lunch offerings, revenge is a dish best served cold.
author: Darin E.

description: The sandwiches are HUGE and generous considering they're only $7 and located right next to the Embarcadero. Also, blue bottle coffee was only $3 considering they're usually $5 at whole foods. Love love love this place! A market that's super reasonably priced in SF, YAAASS!
author: Shela D.

description: Although this place is one of my favorite delis I am saddened to report that the liver pate it once had is no longer as a featured sandwich. I have enclosed a few pictures of my delightful Sammy from earlier today but still sad that they change the menu. Still a great location and pretty good prices for the embarcadero.
author: Martie A.

description:
Short Story:
Their chicken salad tastes bland.

Long Story:
I came here on a Saturday afternoon on my way to AT&T park.  I stopped to get some food and drink and the place was fairly crowded but not too bad.  I got some chicken salad and it was not the best.  It tasted a bit bland for me and it was a bit pricey.  

Verdict:
I probably would not go back.
author: Michael W.

description: I wanted to like to place because i believe in supporting local small businesses, but they have the worst service here! The lady behind the counter is rude and has the worst attitude. The sandwich was mediocre at best, and the pre-made food was stale and bland. Like others have mentioned, Safeway may be the way to go.
author: Mindy C.

description: Amazing salad bar! So many things to choose from! Also, great deli sandwiches and if you don't want to break the bank they always have a daily sandwich special for $4.99.
author: Sara C.

description:
This is a really conveniently placed shop (the nearest supermarket is a 20 minute walk away). There's a good selection of groceries and other goods. Some things are reasonably priced, others are overpriced - as you would expect, it being a small shop. 

There is also a deli and salad bar with warm and cold foods which are great for a quick lunch, and there is outdoor seating. 

The only real downside is how rude some of the employees are... Not all of the people who work here are sullen and impolite, but a significant few most definitely are.
author: Kira G.

description:
This place is such a gem! Sooo thankful to have this place a block down from my place!

They have probably the best premade sushi ever - fresh every day and amazing La Brea French and sour dough baguettes

I love their salad bar and deli - the premade salads are awesome and pretty unique, delicious hot + ready breakfast sammies (on croissants, bagels, or English muffins) 

They are a pretty legit market - have anything you can think of +20% Markup (oh well)  but I've always been happy with every lunch or grocery item I've gotten - I just wish they had more fresh flowers for sale 

:)
author: Shanna N.

description:
You know how much stuff costs at the grocery? Think about how much that same stuff costs at Whole Foods. But that isn't the end. Take another price leap, and you've now found yourself in Bayside Market. Every time I've walked in, my subconscious has kept making item-for-item $ comparisons between here and Whole Foods or Pride (aka Rainbow). I get turned-off at the inflation and decide to just leave.

Conclusion: This place is bigger than it seems from outside, well-stocked, and $convenient$ if you can't wait, but it's otherwise worth the several blocks walk or brief MUNI ride (or car, or fixie, or those tiny yellow tourist cars) to one of the other cheaper aforementioned shops. Plus, there are a Safeway and a host of little eateries in the same neighborhood.
author: Dan B.

description:
These are my lunch friends.

I go down to the market with one coworker, and then yap it up with the staff behind the deli counter. They're great people.

Food is great too. Hot plate on Friday is the fancy salmon. I usually stick to the salad bar, as it's solid every day of the week.
author: Sean H.

description: I had the unfortunate experience of going to this place twice on the same day . On Saturday may 29th we stopped by this corner store to buy some Advil . We were both well dressed because we had a reservation for a yacht cruise . The service was lackluster but I didn't pay it any mind . After the cruise ended around 5pm on our way back I really had to use a restroom . Since we had already been customers there a few hours prior and its proximity we stopped by this store to use their restroom . I was told by a young man that the clerk at the counter had the keys . I asked this clerk and he proceeded to tell me the rest room is closed , just like that  . I looked at this man in disbelief because at this point i had been holding it for a little while and didn't want to demean myself by urinating in some bushes in public . This man clearly did not care . I expressed to him that I really had no options at this  point and I really needed his help . He just looked at me and refused even after we told him we had been customers there earlier . I decided to leave because I had to use the rest room really badly and low and behold just around the store there were restrooms . No lights in the room and had no time to find a switch because I was too busy trying to find the urinal.   I had to use the flash light from my phone to see where the urinal was , but atleast I was glad that  ordeal was over  .in the least he could have told me there was one right around the corner. I came back out to see my friend expressing how disappointed she was in the way they treated me . They had tried to intimidate her with an off duty cop who was buying something from the store . Be rude to me all you want but to try and intimidate my loved one because you do not want to own up to your mistake and discrimination  is crossing the line . Safe to say being black in a suit doesn't merit the use of a bathroom in this horrible disgusting place . Our money is good for you but we are not good enough to use your restroom . I would advise anyone who has any sense of justice and self respect not to use this store . The people I dealt with except the young man were vile and should not be doing business if they will continue to discriminate based on skin color . I'm out
author: Robertson S.

description:
LOVE BAYSIDE.

I live in the apartment complex that this is attached to and it is insanely convenient. Some things are marked up, but worth it due to convenience and honestly, the nicest staff ever! 

I eat here for lunch often: their salad bar is killer and they have an awesome veggie sandwich. Their deli pastas and salads are great too!
author: Lauren A.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. The salads cost the same for me to make as in REDMOND, Washington (middle of nowhere land 15 miles from Seattle, where all the Microsofties go).

Pay 8 bucks for a giant salad with everything from falafel to eggs to sundried tomatoes, edamame, avacado,tofu to that Ceviche with the shrimps, and MORE.

Plud fruit and sushi. And, sandwiches-- this place has you covered.
author: Alice ..

description: The food in there is 5 stars but the service is about a 1.5. I think I will list everything. If you want the best sandwich maker its the short middle aged blonde lady she makes them the best. After that its hit or miss with the other workers. There is this tongan or somoan girl who works the counter and she is the rudest worker there. I mean I have endless encounters with her because I work in the area so trust me. She is rude as hell. The manager is pretty cool his name is Tony and when I needed to return something or was over-charged he took care of me so i have no quarrels with him. But that reminds me you should really look at your receipts because they will over charge you.They have the freshest meats and wide variety of cheese and bread or whatever other what-nots you may need in there. Oh yea everything is over-priced but hey you gotta expect that in this type of neighborhood.
author: Johnnie C.

description:
I am so sick of this place.  They will continue to do a brisk business because of the location, but the employees are such a-holes, that you (business owner -- whoever you are) -- will never get a dime more than I am desperate to spend.  What I am trying to say is that because of convenience, I end up making a few purchases from time to time, but only out of desperation.  Most (not all, but trust me, MOST), of your employees are jerks.  

The example that put me over the edge to finally write a review occurred just moments ago.  I purchased 3 packs of smokes (plus some snack items), and requested a handle bag.  The clerk made mocking faces at me so I said, "What?" -- and he said, "Seems a bit much."  What the heck?  Aren't I going to pay 10 cents for the bag?  

Then -- as I was walking away with my back turned to him, he said "Go on and smoke some more."  I turned around and asked him to repeat himself and he said he didn't say anything.  I was stunned but at the same time, the employees at this market are so rude, they clearly know they can get away with anything.  So, ... I am DONE with this place.  

I did a quick online search to see if I could find an email address for a manager, or some information about the corporate parent of this place -- nothing really came up.  So -- this is what you -- Bayside Market -- get.  A public shaming.
author: E C.

description: No wonder that I go to this market often, the staff this morning was rude. I was holding a cup of coffee and he asked what was it and I looked at him that it was obvious and said coffee and he smirked under his breath and kept turning his head.
author: Magda G.

description:
I came by during a walk in the morning, I was a little hungry so I picked up a breakfast burrito, ham. But where was the ham? It was 80% egg 10% wrap, 5% cheese, and 1% ham. Yes I know, that's 96%, it was wrapped so bad the 4% accounts for all the air between. My eggs were green...flipped green! I stopped eating half way...

Besides that, the stomach ache I had and trips to the bathroom definitely made up for the horrible decision to get food here. I mean out of all the perfectly good breakfast places to eat in the area I pick a convenient store to eat? That is totally my bad, and I paid dearly for it. 

Get what you usually get at convenient stores, chips, soda, snacks.
author: Nye T.

description:
I love this place! I always come here when I have the munchies because they have everything! I've tried their sushi, which is better than trader joe's/safeway/cosco sushi. The people working there are super friendly and attentive. 
And they have great hours! The only place I can get coffee around here at 7am or pepsi at 9pm.
author: Wanda M.

description:
Got lunch at the sandwich counter today - kind of annoying if you want to try a little bit of several things - they have to weigh them separately to price them. Also not everything in the display was labeled so I couldn't tell what the prices were or really what everything was. This was a late lunch, at like 2pm, but I still think everything should be labeled.

Because I tried so many things, I ended up with like 5 containers each half filled with different items. I ended up putting them all in a bigger lunch container once outside to make it easier to all eat together.

- Orzo salad - lacking on flavors. Not much to brag about. The peppers were diced too big and detracted rather than added from the salad.

- Tabouli - too much greens, not enough other stuff. Too mushy and too wet also.

- Exotic bean salad with walnts and green cauliflower - nice! Really liked this one. Subtly sweet, good crunch from the walnuts.

- Hummus - liked the slightly chunky texture. And it has chives I think for flavor.

- Falafel -  they should offer to heat this up for you right? Well once I heated it on my own, it was really good. Chewy and a little crumbly good texture and flavors, plus a little kick of spice.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Best meatball sandwich in town!!! You must come check out all the fresh amazing food they have!!!
author: C-oNe T.

description:
One night, my boyfriend and I were about to make a late fajita dinner. 
I had marinated our chicken, prepared the shrimp, got the guacamole, the veggies, a gorgeous heirloom tomato, and I asked my boyfriend to hand me the Trader Joe's tortillas.
To my utter horror, they had gone bad after a few days because Trader Joe's does not put preservatives in their items.

My boyfriend suggested fajita-less tortillas, but that wasn't going to cut it for me. 

I looked at the time and saw that it was 8:59pm. I called Bayside Market and said, "Can you PLEASE just be open for ONE more minute?! I need TORTILLAS! I know you close at 9!"

They told me to hurry so I ran downstairs in my pjs and knocked on the door. All chairs have been stacked away and they were wiping the tables. The cashier looked up and was like, "Are you the tortilla lady?!" And I said "Yes!"
They showed me the tortillas and I grabbed them and paid in cash.
I ran back upstairs and opened the door and said to my boyfriend in triumph, "I'm the tortilla lady!"
author: Aggie Z.

description:
Terrible, terrible, TERRIBLE customer service. Did I mention that the 'customer service' was terrible?

Stumbled upon this place during a lunch time walk and noticed that they have a deli in the back. I was craving a sandwich so I went in. The menu looked promising -- they offer pepper turkey and cranberry on dutch crunch which is my FAVORITE! There were 3 women working the deli and two of them seemed very friendly -- the other appeared to be Ms. Grumpy McGrumps. So you know who to avoid during your trip, she is the late 40's/early 50's, short, Hispanic female. 

Anywho, as fate would have it, Grumpy McGrumps finishes up with her customer and I'm next. Lucky me! 

She says -- and I'm not kidding: 'What do you want?' (Yes, she said it with an attitude) Me: 'Hi. I'd like a pepper turkey on dutch crunch with cranberry, please.'
McGrumps: Looking at me as though I have 5 eyeballs, "Ok. What else?"
Me: "That's it. Just one sandwich."
McGrumps: "WHAT DO YOU WANT ON THE SANDWICH?"
Me: "pepper turkey, cranberry with everything on it."
McGrumps: "Next time say you want everything on it if that's what you want."
Me: "Okie dokie."
McGrumps: "These people need to learn to say what they want."

At that point, I said nothing more. She proceeds to make my sandwich, very aggressively pulling out the bread, slapping fixins on it, etc.

I work too hard for my money (actually, I don't), and I thought to myself, "you know what? I'm done with this place!." So I simply left the store (never to return again) and came upon the Brannan Street Café a few blocks away!
author: M. A.

description:
Calling all sammie addicts!!

I've been coming here for the past year and have loved the variety of food choices. Salads, soups, sandwiches! You can even sit outside at their tables on a nice day.

But recently, I discovered their "sandwich of the week" special for only $4.79! Included in the sandwich are lettuce, tomatoes, onions, mustard/mayo, and pickles (yum!). Cheese? only an extra $0.50. On a dutch crunch roll? PLEASE! Theirs is bomb! Toasted? Yes!

They also have any other deli meat you can imagine if you don't happen to like the sandwich of the week's. 

I am also a huge fan of the salad bar - a bounty of fresh vegetables, greens and a wide variety of fix-ins. However, the clincher for this place 
was the sandwiches. :)
author: Erin C.

description:
I rely on Bayside market way too much, but that's because I know I can.  Yes, they're prices are a bit higher than Safeway or TJ's, but that's because it's basically a convenience store, not really a full blown supermarket.  That being said, they always have what I'm looking for, whether it's any flavor of Ben & Jerry's, garlic salt, shoe laces, or bleach.

They have a great salad bar that I pass by too often in search of something less healthy, but I have eaten there before and it is great.  They also have a great deli counter with tasty sandwiches, paninis and everything else you'd expect a deli to have (I love the BLT).
author: Gary M.

description:
Overpriced mediocrity.

I work about a block away and we frequent the deli counter/salad bar. Salad is by the pound at $6.99/lb but there's no scale to weigh it before you check out (not that you should put anything back). Very busy around noon, and the weekly sandwich special is your best value in terms of quality-to-cost. It *is* a grocery store, but the prices are absolutely outrageous on regular grocery items compared to my Safeway out in the 'burbs. It feels more like a general store in a hotel lobby with marked up items for convenience (several condo towers surrounding the store) than a corner store.
author: Brandon P.

description: This place is overpriced but that's what you pay for the convenience!  Love this market and the workers are always friendly.  This place is stocked with ready to eat items as well as plenty of alcohol, wines, drinks, etc. in case you've forgotten to buy something.
author: Chris L.

description:
People people people, this is a neighborhood market! It's not intended to be your go-to grocery store for your everyday items. Even though I'm pretty sure they want it to be, but it shouldn't be. The prices are definitely higher here, but it's for the convenience of the residents/businesses in the area for a quick jaunt. One day I badly needed chapstick because I left mine at home, and I went down the street here during my lunch break and even though it was overpriced I still got it for the CONVENIENCE. 

I do come here a lot for the food on my lunch break though. I love how they have a salad bar which is usually stocked (during the lunch hour) with fresh ingredients. It's a wide variety of items to make your own salad. That's a benefit I really love is the "make your own". It costs $6.99/lb, a pricey penny for a salad. But usually my salads come out to $4-5 on average. Then again think about getting a salad at a restaurant they're never cheaper than $7 and at Bayside you can make it to however you like it, and it's a lot for $7. 

They also have a deli with some hot foods, pre-made salads, packaged sushi that you would get at Safeway, desserts, and made-to-order sandwiches. I've never had any of the hot foods or sandwiches, but from what my co-workers all say they like it and it's good. 

Once again it's all about convenience though. And they're all very friendly at the store.
author: Grace L.

description: I love this place ! They have a huge selection of things and are always super friendly. They have anything from sushi to wraps and a bunch more.
author: christina a.

description:
This place has a disturbingly large stock of White Castle burgers in the freezer section. 

They also have great sandwiches and some of the best sourdough rolls for said sandwich in the city. I should know. I've looked far and wide.
author: Lindsay M.

description: I've lived in the apartment complex for almost 3 years and have visited the market often.  This place is convenient and has good quality food, but prices have gone up and service has gone down.  The staff is aloof, barely acknowledges you, and gives you attitude if you ask a question.
author: Neil D.

description:
Convenient lil' market. After I finish my last round of petsitting I love stopping by for a light snack or salad. Friendly folks and varied selection of everything!

Think upscale quicky mart! hehe
author: Brandyy S.

description: i ordered a roast turkey sandwich yesterday around 5:10pm (my first time coming here). i told the asian lady what i wanted in my sandwich. i wanted mayo in my sandwich i did NOT say mustard and she puts mustard in my sandwich (i hate mustard). and later on i find a piece of her hair in my sandwich...if everything went well i would have given a 5-star.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Um wow. Salad bar is soooo good.  Its a small market place that has a deli section where you can order a sandwich and what not but this little market has everything your heart desires. 

This place is right off of Embarcadero near Pier 38 where I work occasionally. 

They even have packaged sushi- not sure how good that stuff ever is but my heart was set out in making my own salad. 

The salad bar has everything you can want and capable of putting in a salad and also had potato salad, imitation crab, etc. 

Its about 6 bucks a lb so my salad came out to about 10 bucks but literally had everything that I wanted. It was so satisfying. 

I also was able to treat myself to a European chocolate with strawberry filling. Amazing!
author: Anya R.

description:
The staff is really friendly.

The grocery store is super expensive, so only purchase grocery items if you are in dire need.

The salad bar is generally pretty good, but after about 6pm, everything seems to be picked over and the fruit flies arrive.

The deli is good -- stick to that for hot meals, but avoid the paninis! They are the greasiest sandwiches I have ever come across.
author: Caitlin L.

description:
I like this place a lot... I go there every day as it's right next to my house.

I would give them 5 stars but their meat and seafood selection isn't sustainable.  I'd buy more seafood and meat there if they had wild alaskan salmon, free range and grass fed beef, etc. 

Right now I go to whole foods for this..
author: Kevin B.

description:
PLEASE get compostable containers for the salad bar!!!!! Even Lee's has them now. 
I spend approx $25 bucks a week here and I want to keep coming; but will switch to Lee's salad bar if you keep wasting with plastic containers. 

Also space mgmt tip -- the line for the register is waaay too close to the salad bar and people are having to squeeze in. All you have to do is move that candy shelf over.
author: mary s.

description: Ya know? Generally this place is pretty good. The food is fresh, and tasty and there's a pretty good selection. The staff is... satisfactory, but then again, its a small grocery, i'm not trying to expect top -notch customer service here. On the flip side, I hope your wallet is on a diet, because it's about to slim down a bit, things are quite expensive.
author: Ben Z.

description:
Bayside Village Market was my choice for salad bar this afternoon. Right across the street from DeLancey Street restaurant and practically on the water, it is an absolutely PERFECT place for a relaxing and peaceful lunch.

I went inside and found a fully stocked salad bar, even though by 1:30 pm, it definitely looked "used." There were a few understocked items (beets and romaine) but the rest of the offerings were fresh and colorful.

I made a salad with raddichio, spring mix and baby spinach. To that base, I added peppers, onion, croutons, kidney beans artichoke hearts, boiled egg slices, avocados and sun-roasted tomates with a raspberry vinagrette dressing. I added a sourdough roll and I was good to go.

I took it outside to a courtyard area with tranquil views of Bayside Village, where meandering pathways and water fountains abound. It was the perfect setting for an "escape" from the hustle and bustle of the City.

And did I mention, THE SALAD BAR is only $6.99 a pound! For the City, that price is unbelieveable, especially for the abundant fresh variety of salad choices!

For those hankering for a deli sandwich, this is the place to go. With a full service deli offering anything you might desire, you won't go away disappointed.

It's easy to get to, just take the MUNI railway N or T lines and it drops you off right at the corner of the Embarcadero and Brannan.
author: David C.

description:
I loooooove this place!  They continue to surprise me by carrying things I would never expect them to have...lowfat buttermilk?  Yes!  Chocolate cheerios? Yes!  Super fresh fruit? Yes!  Fancy cheese?  Yes!  I could go on all day...

The salad bar could be better and some lean cuisine options would be great, but they have far more than I'd expect from a small store.
author: Laura J.

description: It is all about convenience.  We had someone stopping by for breakfast last minute and I had no food. So walking down a block to pick up sausages, oranges, bagels, pancakes and grapes really saved me. :)We've also stopped by in the morning when Red's wasn't open for coffee and a breakfast sandwich and it wasn't bad.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Went to charge a snapple and was told there was a $5 min
I heard this is an illegal practice. Is this true?
I went somewhere else.
author: Daniel B.

description:
I've been getting lunch from Bayside Market for the last two years. I frequent the salad bar and aside from customers messing things up a bit, I've never seen anything unsanitary. I actually find their ability to always have extremely fresh and crisp lettuce really impressive. I can't find lettuce that fresh in any store around here! The salad bar toppings are plentiful and there's just so many options it's hard not to load up and go a little overboard.

I'm also a big fan of their sandwiches and they make them really quickly. As soon as you give your order the nice sandwich ladies turn their back to you and start working, but keep talking! They can hear you and never miss a thing - extra pickles, no onions? You got it. You can't go wrong with the weekly special sandwich  always priced at $4.99. The sandwiches are massive and can easily feed two people so you are definitely getting a deal. 

They have a fun gourmet candy section and lots of  baked goods (brownies, cookies and cakes) for the sweet tooth.
author: Allison B.

description: I love the salad bar and deli.  The food is tasty.  They have a little of everything so if you're in a pinch and didn't get it from the supermarket, it's an easy walk from most of Rincon Hill neighborhood.
author: Eileen L.

description:
Wait in line and order the golden gate sandwich at the deli... You won't regret it.

Don't eat the whole thing or you WILL regret it; it goes down like a brick.
author: Hayley W.

description:
I'm biased by their dazzling location and their convenient hours. Yes, I occasionally come home from work after 8 pm, but guess what? Bayside Market has some scalloped potatoes ready for me to eat! ^_^

I assume it's expensive because their costs are high -- after all, they have to pay premium rent and they stock really quality products. But I'll pay that price to get Honest Tea and POM Wonderful within steps of my front door. Yeah, I can be a yuppie brand snob.

On the other hand, for some reason, they don't drastically discount their hot foods at the end of the day. Why not?? Are you really going to try to sell that again tomorrow? I don't think so.
author: Sharon W.

description: Bomb ass salad bar and my co-worker is addicted to their sandos. Service is a little surly from the one cashier who runs hot and cold but who cares, it's takeout!
author: Nicole O.

description:
Perfect day to be Bayside.

It's September in the city. The weather is gorgeous. Bay Bridge looks about as spectacular as it's going to get. Lunch called for a walk along the Embarcadero.

Bayside was being saved for such a day.

While my sandwich wasn't quite as epic as the day ($7 for turkey, cranberry, fixings on a wheat roll is nothing special), it was gone before my walk back was finished.

Five stars for the bay side walk. Three stars for Bayside's sandwich.
author: Jason B.

description:
really convenient but really expensive.  Also stay away from the salad bar... bugs are everywhere in the food there..

really solid sandwiches though!
author: Shawn A.

description:
For everyone who thinks the salad bar is awesome:

There are baby fruit flies swarming around it, on the containers of sauce (especially around the lids / holes -- where they can creep inside), and pretty much around the entire vicinity of this so called "awesome "salad bar.

You're in luck. We all know some fruits/vegetables are seasonal - I think the fruit flies are too (around summer time only). I still won't touch that salad bar though.

Besides that, the only word I can describe Bayside Market as is CONVENIENT. Two stars for that. Sure, there's a vast variety but variety doesn't necessarily equal good, quality brands. We bought a block of Parmesan cheese here and the whole thing was really hard, as if we bought an entire block of rind. Oh yea, it didn't taste like anything - definitely lacking that yummy nutty flavor. (ha ha.)

And I'm no Bill Gates to try every single brand here, since it's pretty expensive too. I do my real grocery shopping at Safeway, several blocks down. We go to Bayside when we need something quick (ie. 1 jalapeno pepper).

Decent variety of snacks, again, very convenient!
author: T L.

description:
Sorry, I can't say I have a problem with the salad bar.  I haven't had any fruit fly sprinkles in my cesar yet.  I actually like this place.  It's really a convenient place to grab lunch when I'm working.  Yes, it's expensive but then again it's not a major grocery store either.  

I'll be back for more!  ^_^
author: Duckie A.

description: Awesome fresh sandwiches....I miss deli's like these with the authentic meat and all of the trimmings.   Plus I was super excited to see that they sold Kinders candy...one of my favorite Eurpean candies!
author: Lisa H.

description: There is no website for Bayside Village Market and no way to contact management.  I was in earlier today and the checkout clerk was so rude and unhelpful.  I wanted to send an email compliant to management so they could know what poor customer service people are getting, but there is no way to contact RJ's Markets (who owns Bayside Village market and Rincon Center Market and Levi Plaza market.)  Usually the staff here is pretty friendly and so I was really surprise when this checker was so awful. Seems like this Yelp page is the only way to get a hold of them which is a bit shady.
author: Laura A.

description:
If you live in the 'hood, this place will be a frequent stop for you... They carry all the essentials for cooking... plenty of specialty snacks and drinks... produce and meats... booze and tobacco... lots of condiments... paper products and the like... 

minus one star for not having a good selection of deli cheese...
author: Jen D.

description:
Just go for the salad bar - $6 will get you a reasonable salad if you're not too hungry (at $6.99/lb circa early 2012). 

Everything else is +$1/$2 over stores like Safeway/Wholefoods/Walgreens. But hey, if  you're coming here often, you're probably living in SOMA, and if you chose to live in SOMA...it's your fault you didn't chose to live somewhere else.
author: Asdf F.

description: Beware when you have to return something even if you have a receipt. I tried to return a product I bought (complete with receipt) because it was expired, and at some point the manager says, "how can I be sure you got it here, its been a while".  A pity I have bought many items here but I will never return.
author: MK G.

description: My family and I have been shopping at Bayside Market for over 20 years. The checking clerks they hire just keep getting more rude, holier-than-thou and pretentious. The prices have crossed the line into downright robbery. And now they've implemented the most ridiculous policy of closing the restrooms for several hours during baseball games, even if you are a paying customer. This market is a mile from the stadium, mind you. This was the last straw. I left my groceries at the register and walked out.
author: N I.

description:
I do most of my gorcery shopping(most snacks and milk) her in Bayside market. I go there 3 times a week. 

The salad bar is fresh and the selection is pretty good, Shrimp salad and Avacado are my favourite.

The cheese selection is well-organized and complete for a small scale grocery store. 

I am a regular on their snack shelf! I consumed a lot since 4 year ago.

Another reason I like the grocery store is people.
Once I left my wallet at the counter at night. I did not notice that untill next morning when I was in a cab. So I called the store with a slightly possibility they might have it. They told me that the customre turned in my wallet and they put it in the safe! Isn't this life saving? Thank you Bayside and my neighbor who ever shopped there and turned in my wallet!
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
The scope of this review is mainly limited to their special sandwiches of the week, which are a great deal $4.50 for a pretty reasonably side deli sandwich and they always seem to have my favorites on special (pepper salami? Yes please.)

So they get massive props for that great sandwich deal. But I've rarely indulged into anything else at Bayside Market, the prices are higher and I could just as easily bike down to the Safeway to get it there (and probably healthier too). But I'm glad to know that if there is an emergency, I could run down here and be saved because of their very good selection and variety. Maybe after a few more salary raises Bayside Market...
author: Roland C.

description:
Nothing special about this place, other than three things: 

1) the Bay 

2) the $3.99 sandwich special.  I go here once or twice a week and order the special on dutch crunch (pretty big hunk of bread) without even asking what meat is on special.  

otherwise its a pretty average place, mostly overpriced, but what else are you going to do, walk/drive to Safeway?  Hell no, you're going to be a sucker like me and pay more for the convenience.  The beer/wine selection is OK, and the produce is always well-stocked.  The other deli items are either overpriced, or look like they've been sitting there for weeks.

Oh yeah, what was the third good thing about this place?  

Hot checker girl!

***

11/30/07 update

hot checker girl seems to be gone :(

and...don't try the eggplant wrap - it tastes EXACTLY like a dead body...
author: Daryl W.

description:
Bayside's salad bar puts Whole Foods to shame - both from a selection perspective and price-wise. They have a variety of lettuces/greens and TONS of different toppings to choose from. Everything is super fresh, never wilted or brown looking. 

I'm also a big fan of their beverage selection and their deli sandos, but the salad bar is where it's at.
author: Kristen A.

description: This place is really bad. I only go when really desperate as there are so few places to run in and pick up a couple of items. But this last experience was SO BAD- I had to post a warning. Looking to grab a quick snack to eat while I waited for my hair appt to start- ordered what I thought would be arguably the SAFEST fail proof thing to order from the nightmare of their so called deli counter. Yup I ordered a peanut butter and jelly on whole wheat bread- it is listed on the wall menu. The woman who prepared it did not seem to know how to make it! I know - hard to be believe but I am not kidding. She used what looked like a 3 foot thin sword to get the peanut butter out of jar! That was a real eye opener. She then wipes the long sword on a filthy dirty rag by the garbage and uses it again to get out the jelly. That was enough for me. I said never mind and walked out. Last time. Ever.
author: Robyn G.

description:
Yes, this place is expensive if you are buying beers or salads, or fancy pre-made designer foods, but damn! I think it could be worth the money. They've got these crazy foccacia sandwiches, and their salad bar has fancy gourmet olives, crab cakes, and everything crazy under the sun you would ever want in a salad. Yes, their designer foods (pesto raviolis, meatloaf, calamari cocktails) can be an outrageous $9.00 a lb, but I hope to afford to eat this well some day.

If you are looking for a deal, try the $3.99 weekly sandwich special!Awesome meat, and veggies including peppercinis and onions and spreads - all this for $3.99???? That is a steal for a city sandwich that isn't Subway. The other cheap thing I am addicted to here - the $.40 dolmas (grape-leaved wrapped rice with some kind of lemony sauce) yuuuuuum . . .  I actually just had my co-workers pick me up three of those babies, and I went on to immediately make my 3rd sale of the day! It was the power of the dolma.

If you don't really care about spending money, you can definitely get some beers, an awesome spread, and sit at the (albeit rickety) tables facing the Bay, and the Bay Bridge. Definitely a nice way to spend the afternoon. If you do care about spending money, bring your own beers, and get the $3.99 special!
author: Alex G.

description: Right around the corner from me, this place has almost everything you need. The deli is good too.
author: Lefty R.

description:
loses only 1 star for being a bit pricy, but that's the price you pay for convenience and a great selection. If you work in the area, it's a god send.
Great for a quick bite, but it can get a bit crowded during the lunch rush.
Don't diss "the check out girl" she's very sweet, and the rest of the staff is pretty friendly too.
Grab some lunch and enjoy a great view of the bay here!
author: W W.

description:
One single pack of ramen noodle costs $0.87

Need I say more?
author: Lindsay A.

description: Salad bar is amazing!  Lots of choices and everything is very fresh as opposed to some salad bars when you can tell they've left it out all day.  They also have good sandwiches and feature a special sandwich daily for only $6.00!  The grocery part of the market is a bit overpriced, but that's pretty standard in soma.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Damn you RJ's, DAMN YOU!!!!!!!!!

Your damn convenience, and your damn hot food counter, and your damn salad bar and your damn charcuterie and cheese and alcohol selection.  

Why drag myself to Trader Joe's which is 7 blocks away and will undoubtedly cost 1/2 of what I will spend at RJ's when I can meander downstairs in my PJ's and pay $40 for a standard milk and egg run? It's like crack, I tell you. No matter how you try to avoid it, you always end up giving in!
author: Eli B.

description: Great little corner market with a surprisingly good selection of healthy and vegan options, good beer selection, great salad bar, good sandwiches, and an always friendly staff.  My only complaint is that it's super expensive for all the groceries.  Great shop to have nearby work though.
author: Brian C.

description: This place is right under my building. But it smells :( Every time I go there there is this really bad odor throughout the store that kills my appetite and I end up leaving the place. I think they use a dirty mob to clean the floor.
author: T I.

description: I don't shop here for my groceries, or my produce because they don't have a great selection and the prices are too high. I do L.O.V.E. their salad bar and deli counter though. May I suggest a green salad with one of their awesome meatballs heated and sprinkled on top?
author: Bronwyn W.

description:
At a first glance, the place looks a bit dicey, but it has quite a lot of quick pick-me-up options. The deli makes sandwiches to order, and the size of the sandwiches is quite big. On the downside, the groceries are a bit expensive, but when you're in a hurry or just want to pick up a snack, this place is very handy since the nearest grocery stores (as far as I know) are Safeway and Whole Foods, which aren't all that convenient in this location. 

There's a variety of things available, and while I couldn't give this place a better rating, I think you should still check it out if you're living in the area  because of the convenience. When I don't feel like making the trip to the grocery store or hunting for take out, this is my go to option.
author: Sweta M.

description: At the Bayside Market are fresh fruit, a great deli, and yummy cheese. Be warned, it is pricey. Try the feta salad if you have a taste for something a bit different, but don't go looking for portobella because it won't be there.
author: Evelyn B.

description:
This market is convenient for some quick items, has some decent food and a pretty good wine selection, but there are some downfalls.

-Overpriced - Yeah, you can argue that a convenience market should be pricier than Safeway, but then why are the wines and food at Gabby Cafe, a couple blocks away, so much cheaper and that store is far nicer?
-Employees - I go into this place and they are not friendly at all.  Has anyone ever heard of customer service?  There is this very attractive brunette girl working there, but she doesn't even say hi to anyone when you're at the checkout line.  Has she ever thought that its us customers that buy the food at the store, to keep it in business and to pay her salary?
author: Aaron M.

description:
Like many others have said, this is the local market for me.  Close to work and home, so I frequent here like a fly on shit.

The fresh produce seems to always be ripe, which is great and unlike the alternative and a longer walk to Safeway.

There are always warm foods and good soups as well.

The pre-packaged foods there are healthy alternatives to the 7-11 triangle sandwiches and the Asian women who always checks me out can tell how my day is going, she is really chill and very sweet.

They have outside seating a great view of the bay if you just want to get your food and chill, plus it is a market so you can get everyday necessities such as toilet paper and Advil.

They have good breakfasts and lunch options but I think it closes before I get off, so I'm not sure how late they stay open.

It can get pricey, but I would rather support small individually owned markets that those huge corporations that typically drive places like these out of business.
author: Lauren G.

description: This place is ridiculously convenient to anyone living in the south beach area, but prices are definitely inflated compared to Safeway, which is to be expected from a small store. They have a pretty decent alcohol selection, as well as fruits and veggies and cheeses. The meat/fish is very lacking, as they only have a handful of pre-cut vacuum-sealed (non-tasty) options... There is a small deli to order sandwhiches or some of the hot foods, but for the most part, this is a last resort when you need something quick (and before 9pm...) as it sits out all day.
author: Matt H.

description: My wife and I live very near this market. It is a jewel in our neighborhood. I know that their biggest attraction is their lunch crowd, but we go there all times of the day, and not during lunch. It's a minor riot at lunchtime because there sandwiches are so good and very reasonably priced. I suspect most of the shoppers miss the other aspects of the story that attracts me. They have organic milk, great produce, Niman ranch meets, a decent cheese selection, cheddar cheese flavored popcorn, a credible salad bar, great chocolate chip cookies, and a hell of a wine selection for such a small place. Plus the staff is always nice. I see some complaints about staffing, but I have never experience any attitude from any staff person. And when, like now, we have not shopped for food and the traffic is going to get gnarley in San Francisco, I will be walking down to Bayside and shop for my dinner. When the locals run out of stuff, we know where to shop.
author: Aldon H.

description:
I like Bayside. They're good people. They have $3.99 sandwich specials everyday and their chicken tamales are all right!

Plus they have the no cookie cookie which is hard to find. All old school whole foods shoppers should know what I mean.

And their rice crispy treats are huge!
author: Adrienne H.

description:
This little market has everything! A huge salad bar, a hot lunch buffet, sandwiches, paninis, packaged lunches, sushi, wraps, fruit salads, nice cheeses, soups, and even shrink wrapped steaks. STRANGE. 

It's a bit pricey and sometimes their pre-packaged lunches are hit or miss (hence the 4 not 5 stars), but it's conveniently located in an area that doesn't have a lot of affordable lunch options, and has a large enough variety that it doesn't get boring. I have their salad bar every day, but mostly because I'm kind of a health nut and it's the only place to buy a decent salad in the area. 

Check it out. They have *everything*.
author: Jeff K.

description: Like another use mentioned, it is convergent - yet pricey.  If you need some milk or detergent in a pinch, this is a solid option.  Other than that, you are doing yourself a disservice if you are trying to get all of your grocery needs here.
author: Joshua B.

description:
Tons of stuff in this little store. Tons of good stuff. Tons of tasty, delicious, good stuff to cram in your food-hole when the stomach is on empty.

If you can afford 300% of normal price for it! Who likes to pay for convenience? Not me! I mean... I always end up paying rather than walking, but I don't like it!
author: Alex C.

description:
At Bayside Market you pay higher prices for convenience, which is definitely worth it!

They have pretty good produce, they have a pretty good deli (which has dolmas for $.40 each), they sell pretty much everything Safeway would have (a little less selection).

If you live close and run out of sugar, you no longer have to ask your neighbor, just go to Bayside Market!
author: Elaine S.

description:
I love that this little market actually has much more to offer than you would expect, and that I could technically do all of my grocery shopping here if I wanted to because they have everything from ready-made meals and a large variety of deli foods, to soups, salad bar, produce (which, by the way, is MUCH MUCH MUCH better than any of the mushy, scraggly looking things that Safeway calls fruits and veggies), to dried and frozen goods.  When I had mixed together everything for cupcakes and realized I had none of those paper baking cups, I ran downstairs and they even carried those!!

That being said, this place might be a little more expensive than your average grocery store, but it's incredibly convenient, the deli food is generally pretty amazing, they carry tons of little specialty foods that are fun to try now and then ... and, again, the produce is usually not just edible, but fresh and delicious, which is WAY more than I can ever say for Safeway.  I actually prefer their pears to the ones at Whole Foods, and make the extra trip (ok, it doesn't really take much time or effort, but still) to go downstairs just to get some of their pears ... they also have delicious, fresh bread that you can take home, then bake in your oven for like 5-7 minutes, and voila!  I practically made it from scratch ... or so my hypothetical dinner guests might think.
author: Kristen H.

description:
MM! The deli food is very good, and always tastes fresh. 
I've tried their 
-mac-n-cheese 
-scalloped potatoes 
-apple pie 
-hummus 
-dolmas 
-caprese salad   (all are delicious!) 
They also have really marshmallow-y rice krispie treats for sale by the registers. 

You can sit outside if it's sunny, and it's right by the Embarcadero so it's kind of an interesting place to have lunch. 

I wouldn't buy anything here other than deli stuff, though; in other words, don't try and do your grocery shopping here. Everything is "gourmet-priced," regardless of what it is you're buying.
author: Heidi G.

description: I frequent this market, mostly because I work across the street.  But I haven't been rudely disappointed by anything so far.  The deli sandwiches are always big and fresh, even though they use dijon mustard instead of regular mustard, which I dislike, but strangely can't ever remember to tell them that.  So far, so good.  And people, look at it's prime location - obviously it's going to be pricey.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
Bayside Market is set up like a corn maze. Or as my people call it, a maize maze.

It has all the quintessential items for a picnic at South Park:
salad bar
sandwich bar
delicious array of cheese
little bottles of wine
fruit
cookies
condoms. Kidding, that's disgusting. Seriously. Seriously.

I could see moving to an apt. here just to be closer to this market.
author: A W.

description: Outside seating, supersized sandwiches, a salad bar, booze...what more could you want?  This is a well stocked neighborhood grocery and a good spot for a takeout lunch.
author: Garrett D.

description: For the incredible convenience their prices are fair and they have everything from cheap beer to vintage wines, chicken wings to meatloaf. I'm impressed. Given their monopoly on the area they could be over-priced, filthy pigs and probably make even more money, but they aren't. I'm happy supporting this locally-owned business that does things right.
author: Arek T.

description:
this is inspired by the lovely dds review awhile back.

pack of marlboro lights
+
six pack of beer
+
some beef jerky
+
chips

=

ONE HUNDRED FUCKING MILLION DOLLARS!??!?! 

well ok, youre the only joint in town.
author: Euge L.

description: only warning is that it's definitely not cheap here....but convenient mini-mart and food bar if you live in south beach (soma)...corner of embarcadero and branna...outdoor seating if you want to sit and enjoy the sun.....quick alternative to safeway for a quick meal or for few missed items...
author: Hen A.

description: Went here to pick up some quick groceries because I was staying at my brother's place. It's a small market and the variety is alright for the size. I came in looking not to spend too much since I just started working in the area. Staff was friendly and the place wasn't too busy but people were coming in. If you were on a tight budget and needed a good variety of foods, I'd recommend another local supermarket but if you like the smaller markets go ahead and give this place a shot.
author: Steven C.

description: I live at Bayside Village but feel like this place could double as my second home!Staff are friendly, the deli is great, the fruit and veg section looks marvellous (one day I will purchase a token apple), they have booze, fancy chocolate, regular chocolate, a muffin cabinet, sushi, sexy bread and Irish bacon. Only reason they don't get five stars is because they don't cater to my most shameful addiction...gossipy trashy magazines. If I don't get my fix of how much weight Hollywood has lost this week or the latest fashion in bush topiary, I get the shakes...but a little snipe of wine from Bayside Market helps to take the edge off!
author: Sarah J.

description: Their tuna salad is terrible. I bought 1/4 lb and couldn't eat one bite. I'm not sure they even use tuna, it tastes more like mackerel.
author: Rick B.

description:
the fastest way off the Bay Bridge to getting a drink!

We have all been on that damn bridge during rush hour, giants madness, or during an unexpected accident.  It can take hours to get over, my record is 3!  Yesterday was no exception- I needed to get in the city and hop on a flight- that bridge about did me in.
This place is a life and nervous system saver.

This place you can usually park off Brannan, get a drink, bottle of wine or beer and feel better in about 5 minutes.  The also have decent food and bathroom!

I lived in this area for a few years and think the market and people that work their are awesome!!
author: rachel c.

description: This is a little corner market right in my building.  You'd be surprised to find that despite their small interior, they seem to have EVERYTHING I'm looking for...nice fresh produce, great selection of fun cheese, full service deli, prepared foods, raw meats, lots of drinks (alcoholic and non).  Prices are high, but you cant beat the convenience if you live within a half mile of it.  Staff is SUPER friendly too! Thats a huge plus!
author: Cathleya G.

description: I love this place!  I haven't tried their deli counter yet, but their fridge deli has lots of vegetarian and vegan options, including Savvy Savories stuff (awesome spicy peanut noodles and pesto pasta).  I wish the deli counter had labeled veg*n items or ingredient lists.  They also carry a lot of the basics like spaghetti and noodles, juice, etc.  Really nice staff, too.
author: Tony G.

description: It's all about the Dutch crunch bread.  This is a great spot to get a fast and inexpensive deli sandwich.  There are plenty of deli sandwiches to choose and a weekly special. Between the slices of meat, the vegetables on top, and the Dutch crunch bread, this is one of the more filling deli sandwiches around.
author: Josh K.

description: This place is so deceptive. It looks like a small little market with not much to offer from the outside. Upon entering its a whole different story. The lunch options seem endless (deli counter with made to order sandwiches, pre-made meals ready to go, salad bar, etc). The market is impressive as well as they have almost everything you need. I had one of the deli sandwiches and it was a great deal for $6...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Bayside Market is a place to go for the essentials. Plan on paying a bit extra than you might at Safeway or a larger grocery store, but depending on your priorities it could be worth it. We like to stop by here when we need extra ingredients for a meal, or popcorn to go along with a movie rental. Definately worth stopping by if you live in the neighborhood.
author: Erik U.

description: The Bayside Market is near where I work, and offers the best variety of food for everyone. The salad bar is nice, the food on it is always stocked, and fresh. The best part about the Bayside Market is the deli counter. While most of the sandwiches are overpriced, the key to eating there is to get the Sandwich of the Week, AKA the special. Considering the special is only $4.50 eating on a budget is really easy. While the sandwiches aren't as cheap as Subway, they certainly are better.
author: Mark C.

description: I really like this market!  If you work in the SOMA district, its a walk (but a beautiful one). Their sandwiches are top notch!  My favorite is the Avocado and Cream Cheese sandwich on dutch crunch bread. They are all reasonably priced. There are a variety of healthy options for lunch, and a great vegetarian/vegan selection. The store clerks are helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that sometimes it can be very crowded around lunchtime and it's a small place.
author: Jay S.

description:
This market has come to be my savior since I live in Bayside Village.

Salad bar has a good assortment of veggies, which has become my staple dinner.  Be conservative with your portions though, once I went a little chicken-happy and my salad ended up costing over $11.

I like their sandwiches but I couldn't bring myself to like their paninis as much as I tried.  I ended up crying and sniffling through half of the roast beef panini because both slices of bread were completely drenched in horseradish.

I'm also not a fan of the expensive ethnic wraps and prepared foods on their refrigerated shelves, but it looks like they try to mix things up, so once in a while there's a good surprise. 

The market has a good selection of everything else, the ladies behind the deli counter are friendly, and the convenience is usually worth the extra price and time that it would take me to drive to the 4th/King Safeway.  For such a small space it surprisingly stocks pretty much everything you could ask for and then some.
author: S L.

description: A bit higher prices, and the selection is to be expected for a small grocery store, but you can't beat the convenience.
author: Jamieson S.

description:
i get it, but i don't get it.

how the 100 embarcadero commercial space has the worst feng-shui ever, but the bayside market has the best feng-shui -- and they're right across the street from each other!!

i would much rather visit a restaurant there than get ripped off by the obscene bayside market prices and have to shop in an aura of toilet cleaner smell.  but it does earn it's few stars for its excellent location, and at times, for its ability to find that unique piece of produce or product. (like artisinal cookies!) 

like Eliza B. so eloquently puts it -- Damn you RJ's, DAMN YOU!!
author: Diana L.

description: There aren't many options in the neighborhood but i've almost stopped coming here entirely for the salad bar because the lettuce is ALWAYS WET.  I know it is probably a good thing because it means they wash it, but I've got a huge pet peeve and that is a soggy salad. Sorry Bayside Market!
author: Violet C.

description: This place is way above your average quick-stop, which comes as a bit of a surprise to me because that is basically what it (at first) looks like.  Great deli and a bit of exotic produce and lots of ice cream.  What more could you want?
author: Robert M.

description: At the size of a quarter of a Walgreen's, they got a lot of stuff in this mid-sized corner store, and yes, the staff is really quite friendly. They got quite a monopoly in this neighborhood, and this is probably why the stuff is quite a bit overpriced. Also, if you are like me looking for organic produce, good luck! The only organic thing they seem to have is organic milk :( My favorite grocer still is Good Life Grocery on Potrero Hill. Definitely worth the trip!
author: Dr K.

description: This little market is key for me every time I stay in San Francisco.  I stay in a corporate suite so I'm in need of the basics and the Bayside Market always pulls through.  They have everything you could need; ready to eat meals, basic cooking supplies, fresh fruits & veggies, and my favorite, booze.
author: Christopher P.

description: I have never seen a grocery making pay $8.50 for a small can tuna in oil; this place is really overpriced. They are just thieves !!! I wish someone else would open a market nearby because those people are monopolizing the area!!!
author: andrea c.

description:
I only go there because it is so conveniently close. I wish someone would open up a more reasonable competitor in the forever abandoned space right across from it.

Seriously, it is hard to find another grocery store in the city whose prices are this ridiculous.
author: Nima M.

description: Their made-to-order sandwiches are awesome.  Bayside you are vindicated.  Still -1 for the prepackaged foods section.
author: Spicy T.

description: For a corner store, this place is pretty money.  That said, you are going to spend it here too.  Its better then the ball park, but if you need more then a a bag full, get some exercise and walk to Safeway or Whole Foods
author: Porfirio R.

description: What an awesome find!  A neat little grocery store tucked away right near the bay.  This place features lots of incredible vegetarian foods, organic stuff, a huge salad bar, and a friendly staff.  Now that I work in the neighborhood, I'm probably going to spend, like, half my paycheck here.
author: Apollo L.

description: Extremely convenient store for anyone in the area.  All alcohol is about $2 overpriced, but that is what is expected for the ease of experience.  The produce that they have is actually pretty good, and wonderful if you need 1 jalepeno or 1 potato for a recipe that you thought you had.  In a drunken stupor one night myself and a bunch of friends just about emptied out their hot food selection, and all of it was decent.  The staff is helpful and friendly, no complaints at all.  They would get four stars if they were open a bit later.
author: Daniel M.

description: I'm living in  Bayside Village and hadn't had the chance to venture into the market yet.  It looks so tiny from the outside imagine my surprise to walk in and see a full salad bar, deli, hot food, drink/alcohol seletion, gourmet cheese/crackers/cookies, frozen foods, cold essentials, and on and on and on.  I opted to try out the salad bar and YUM.  They had such good choices and it was a great price!  Definetely a place to visit again!
author: Bree W.

description: the deli here is still the best place to get a fully loaded hoagie on the east side of SoMA. totally worth a train ride down from the fidi on a nice day for lunch.
author: Tom H.

description: Excellent lunch place.  They have everything you are in the mood for- sandwiches, premade salads, and a salad bar.  I usually stick to their sandwiches (which are awesome, and they offer a weekly lunch special for about $4.95) and the salad bar.  There are also tables to sit at outside, perfect for the long lunch.
author: Dave P.

description:
super close, super convenient, and they have basically everything.  it just sucks they aren't open very late.

if you're whining about it being expensive then you obviously don't live in the area, and you should probably just go find food in the garbage cans instead.
author: Jason H.

description: Pretty much has what you need. Not the cheapest, but great when you need a few things to complete a meal, a beer run, milk, etc. Also open pretty late which is convenient.
author: Tim T.

description: My local market, right downstairs from where I live.  It's very convenient for a quick salad or sandwich for lunch.  The salad bar is good, although sometimes I get the impression that not everything is as fresh as it should be.  The sandwiches that I've tried were all really good, and my husband really likes the roast turkey sandwich.  Service is very friendly.  For my regular grocery shopping I still go to Safeway (or I have Safeway deliver), but when I'm home and in need of lunch, I always go here.
author: Marijke D.

description: We call it the Millionaire Market, because you have to be a millionaire to shop here on the regular.  All the same, the food is good, the counter has lots of yummy options, and its an easy stop to pick up a few things.  The produce is decent, they have a lot of good food options.  Wine selection is okay.  They have a TON of desserts.  Holy whoa is it pricey though.  I can buy a carton of milk and it will still cost me $30 just to walk in the door.
author: Margaret S.
